Datatool GUI package¶

The GUI is the user’s way of interfacing with the pandas dataframes. They have the ability to apply saved operations, or their own python code. Use df to reference the first open sheet, df2 for the second, etc..

For more in-depth help on using the GUI, refer to the in-app help menu.

For this section of the project, we follow the MVC approach.

Submodules¶

class datatool.gui.Controller.MyWorkingCode(filename=None, path='/home/vesi/documents/bin/datatool/docs')¶

Bases: PyQt5.QtWidgets.QMainWindow, gui.Ui_View.Ui_DataTool

This is the main window of the application. Upon initialization, we bind all of the signals to functions and initialize the UI.

param filename=None:
 The filename of the file we are opening, if we load one on launch.
param path=os.getcwd(:
 The path to the file we want to open, if we load one on launch.

Quits the application.

closeTab()¶

Closes the active tab, releases the memory, and deletes the C++ object.

correctDateFormat()¶
createTab(pandaData, name='Tab')¶

Creates a new tab with the given PandasTable model displayed in a TableView. Automatically appends it to the end of the tab bar.

param panda:The PandasTable model you wish to display
deleteData()¶
duplicateSelected()¶
findAndReplace()¶

Prompts the user to input text to search for and text to replace it with. Accepts regex by default.

Passes the given values to the active Panda to deal with.

getCurrentPanda()¶

Retrieves the currently visible tab’s PandasTable model.

Returns:
PandasTable model
getCurrentView()¶

Retrieves the currently visible tab’s TableView.

Returns:
PyQt5 QTableView
getPanda(index)¶

Retrieves the PandasTable model at the given tab index.

param index:The index of the tab of the desired PandasTable
Returns:
PandasTable model
help()¶
insertBlank()¶
loadData()¶

Prompts the user to select a file to load into view. Deletes all other open tabs upon successful load. If an invalid path is given, the user is notified.

newEmptyTab()¶

Creates a new tab without any data and axi labels from 1-100.

newRowsOnSeparator()¶

Prompts the user for the column and separator and passes the informaiton to the Model.

notifyUser(message)¶

A simple message box to tell the user something. They cannot proceed until they press ‘Ok’.

param message:The message you want to share with the user.
openData()¶

Prompts the user for a file to load into view, instantiates a new PandasTable with the user’s selection and opens it in a new tab. If an invalid path is given, the user is notified.

ranksByProgram()¶

Prompts the user to select a column of unique values (programs) to distribute the other column’s (ranks) values into.

Passes the selected values to the active Panda to deal with.

redo()¶
removeNonNumeric()¶
runCommand()¶

Handles all python code entered into the text area on the bottom half of the application. It automatically converts df, df2, df3, etc.. into valid code representing the open sheets, based on the index of their tab.

You will be notified if the code has any syntax errors via a message box. TODO: Create a new tab when a df outside of current range is specified

saveData()¶

Prompts the user to pick a place to save the active PandasTable as a CSV file and passes the location to the active PandasTable to save to disk.

software_ks()¶
software_rm()¶
toggleCommandPrompt()¶
undo()¶

class datatool.gui.Model.PandaTableHorizontalHeader(orientation=1, parent=None)¶

Bases: PyQt5.QtWidgets.QHeaderView

A custom implementation of a QHeaderView that allows us to doubleclick and edit the column names. This is passed to our TableView upon tab creation.

todo:Allow dragging and dropping columns when Alt modifier is pressed
doneEditing()¶

Called when the user presses Enter in the QLineEdit Note: is called twice every time because of bug in Qt

editHeader(section)¶

Makes the existing QLineEdit visible and changes the geometry to fit the header cell. Called when the user double clicks a header cell.

param section:The index of the header cell
handleMoved(logical, visualOld, visualNew)¶

Changes order of columns in underlying model to match the visual appearance

handlePressed()¶

Allows us to move the column if the Alt modifier is pressed.

class datatool.gui.Model.PandasTable(data, parent=None)¶

Bases: PyQt5.QtCore.QAbstractTableModel

An instance of a pandas dataframe that can be displayed in a PyQt TableView, as well as have procedures applied to it. It requires a dataframe to be initialized.

param data:The pandas dataframe you wish to load in
appendState()¶
backwardState()¶
clearWhitespace(selectionModel)¶

Removes all newlines, leading and trailing whitespace, carriage returns, and invisible tab-breaks from the selected column(s). If no columns are selected, acts on entire dataframe.

Adds a state to the Undo/Redo stack and refreshes the view upon success.

columnCount(self, parent: QModelIndex = QModelIndex()) → int¶
correctDateFormat(selectionModel)¶

Accepts almost any date format and convert it to MM/DD/YYYY.

A column selection is required; user is alerted upon failure to select a column.

Adds a state to the Undo/Redo stack and refreshes the view upon success.

data(index, role)¶

This is called whenever a layoutChanged or dataChanged signal is emitted. Returns the data stored in the df attribute at the given index.

param index:Passed to us by the TableView, a PyQt QModelIndex
param role:Passed to us by the TableView, a Qt.DisplayRole
deleteData(selectionModel)¶

Deletes the selected columns/rows from the table. Adds a state to the Undo/Redo stack and refreshes the view upon success.

param selectionModel:
 The current selection, supplied in a QItemSelectionModel
duplicateSelected(selectionModel)¶

Duplicates the selected row or column and inserts it directly after.

findAndReplace(findText, replaceText, selectionModel)¶

Finds all findText in currently selected columns and replaces with given replaceText. Regex is enabled by default.

Adds a state to the Undo/Redo stack and refreshes the view upon success.

param findText:The text to search for.
param replaceText:
 The text to replace the found text with.

If no selection is given, it will prompt if you wish to apply to the entire dataframe.

flags(self, QModelIndex) → Qt.ItemFlags¶
forwardState()¶
headerData(self, int, Qt.Orientation, role: int = Qt.DisplayRole) → Any¶
initiateStack()¶
insertBlank(selectionModel)¶

Inserts a blank row/column based on current selection.

newRowsOnSeparator(column, separator)¶

Creates new rows from the given column determined by the given separator.

Parameters:
  • column – The column to pull data from.
  • separator – The characters that separate the data.
ranksByPrograms(ranks, programs)¶

Distributes values in ranks column into columns created based on unique values in programs column.

Adds a state to the Undo/Redo stack and refreshes the view upon success.

param ranks:The values that need to be distributed.
param programs:The values to create columns of.
removeNonNumeric(selectionModel)¶

Removes everything but numeric characters from a column.

A column selection is required; user is alerted upon failure to select a column.

Adds a state to the Undo/Redo stack and refreshes the view upon success.

rowCount(self, parent: QModelIndex = QModelIndex()) → int¶
saveData(path)¶
setData(index, value, role=2)¶

Interprets the data we enter when we submit data through the TableView. Appends a state to the stack.

param index:A QIndexModel specifying the coordinates of the changed cell.
param value:A QItemModel storing the new data.
param role=QtCore.Qt.EditRole:
 The role of the passed signal.
translateSelection(selectionModel)¶

Translates a selection model into column labels and row indexes.

param selectionModel:
 A QItemSelectionModel
Returns:
A tuple of column names and row indexes
